snippet: The House Agriculture Committee’s farm bill makes unconscionable cuts to food stamps and free school meals while protecting powerful farm interests.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the House Agriculture Committee for approving a farm bill that would protect generous subsidies for the agriculture industry by cutting food stamps by $16.5 billion over the next decade; notes that bill would deny two to three million people food assistance and end free school meals for 280,000 children.
lead_paragraph: The House Agriculture Committee’s farm bill makes unconscionable cuts to food stamps and free school meals while protecting powerful farm interests.

headline.seo: More Pain for the Working Poor
headline.main: More Pain for the Working Poor
headline.print_headline: More Pain for the Working Poor
